english_translation: It is narrated: Umar ibn Abdul Aziz wrote to Adi ibn Artah, whom he had appointed as governor over Basra: As for what follows, you deceived me with your black turban, your sitting with the reciters of the Quran, and letting your turban trail behind you. You showed me goodness and did well, but Allah has exposed to us what you were concealing. And peace be upon you.

While Umar ibn Abdul Aziz is highly respected, this is not a hadith from the Prophet ﷺ but rather a historical statement of a later Muslim leader.

english_translation: Narrated from al-Zuhri, from Salim, from ibn Umar: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ stood upon the minbar and said: Here is the land of trials (referring to the east), and where the horn of Satan appears - or he said: the horn of the sun. And [separate chain]: From Zayd ibn Aslam, I do not know it except as mursal: He said: Allah has not created any creation except He created what overcomes it. His mercy overcomes His anger, and charity extinguishes sin like water extinguishes fire. And Allah created the earth and it flourished and became decorated, saying: What overcomes me? So He created mountains and made them firm. The mountains said: We overcame the earth, what overcomes us? So He created iron. Iron said: We overcame the mountains, what overcomes us? So He created water. Water said: We overcame fire, what overcomes us? So He created wind. He placed it in the clouds. Wind said: We overcame water, what overcomes us? So He created man building structures that wind cannot penetrate. Man said: We overcame wind, what overcomes us? So He created death. Death said: We overcame man, what overcomes us? Allah said: I overcome you.
